channel.title: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!
channel.description:
Guys, I am not lying with this. So I'll cut straight to the chase.
[b]On MSN there is a virus going around. Someone will message you with the message "Take a look at these photos." or "Hope your parents do see this of you." If you accept, do not open it. And I repeat, do not open it. What it does is gain control of your account. Shut down you computer, and does a lot of damage. My friend just told me on his laptop - his other computer is getting fixed. The file will be like "Image23.zip. If you accept, it will contain a file called www.imageshack.com/image123blahblahblah. Anything along those words. If you click on it, you are infected. I am not lying about this, it is a very powerful virus. I think it sends all of your passwords to the creator too.[/b]
Just a heads up.

item.title: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

yeah iv heard about this stuff for a while

i got caught out once, never again
the one i got wasnt that harmful anyway, but it taught me a less

also, these days i use ubuntu a lot more, and i doubt they work on pidgin

Read full topic
item.source: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!

some random person tried sending it to me and re-nammed it as uber server 3.0 sql database…

item.title: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Mod Adam, post:16, topic:150154”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=205660.msg1814328#msg1814328 date=1192001918]
the moral of the story is you only get viruses on the internet from porn.
[/quote]
So you must have tons right?

Anyways, what’s the name of the account sending the messages? Or is it more than one?[/quote]

It’s everyone who has opened it. It does an auto send every few minutes to all your contacts.

Read full topic

item.title: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I got something similar, some shit like “facebook nudes” and it was a file named “super_hot_nudes.jpg.com”. On jotti, 1 scanner flagged it as “safe”.

The moral of the story: don’t accept files from people you don’t know, don’t open nudes from people you do.

Read full topic
item.source: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!

item.source: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!

item.title: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There’s always something like this going around on msn tbh. If it’s not people getting virii from msn, then it’s people getting phished on myspace etc.

Anyway, common sense should prevail: if you get sent some sort of message that does not look like something your friend would write, then ask them if they sent it (talking about messages with links etc). If they didn’t send it, then tell them that their computer has been infected and that they need to reboot into safe mode and run a virus and spyware scan.

Read full topic
item.source: Warning to all msn users! be carefull!
